extendedIngredients.name: brown rice
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 to 10 slices of brown or white bread

extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: butter at room temperature to apply on the breads

extendedIngredients.name: garam masala
extendedIngredients.originalString: chaat masala or sandwich masala to sprinkle on the veggies

extendedIngredients.name: green bell pepper
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 small capsicum/green bell pepper, thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: rock salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: black salt or regular salt or rock salt as required

extendedIngredients.name: salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: black salt to sprinkle on the veggies

extendedIngredients.name: water
extendedIngredients.originalString: little water to grind the chutney

recipes.title: veg cheese toast sandwich | bombay style cheese toast sandwich
recipes.instructions: prepare the chutney first. blend all the ingredients mentioned under the list 'for green mint coriander chutney' in a grinder or small blender. add very little water. the chutney has to be of thick or slightly thick consistency.keep the chutney aside.steam or boil the potatoes and beetroot.peel and slice them thinly,rinse and peel the onions and cucumber. slice them thinly into round slices.rinse and remove the seeds from the capsicum. slice it thinly. also slice the tomatoes thinly. keep the sliced veggies aside. grate the cheese and keep aside.slice the edges of the bread if you prefer. spread butter evenly on all the slices. make sure the butter covers the entire of bread. a generous coating of butter does not allow the bread to become soggy, when you apply the chutney.spread the mint-coriander chutney on all the bread slices.place the onion, tomato, potato and capsicum slices. sprinkle a pinch of chaat masala or sandwich masala evenly on them. also sprinkle a pinch of black salt evenly.now top with grated cheese.cover the sandwiches with the remaining bread slices and place in a preheated toaster or grill.toast for 2 to 3 minutes till the bread gets toasted well and golden. toast the remaining sandwiches in the same way.spread some butter on top of the hot sandwiches and serve cheese toast sandwich hot with the remaining chutney and tomato sauce.

steps.step: prepare the chutney first. blend all the ingredients mentioned under the list 'for green mint coriander chutney' in a grinder or small blender. add very little water. the chutney has to be of thick or slightly thick consistency.keep the chutney aside.steam or boil the potatoes and beetroot.peel and slice them thinly,rinse and peel the onions and cucumber. slice them thinly into round slices.rinse and remove the seeds from the capsicum. slice it thinly. also slice the tomatoes thinly. keep the sliced veggies aside. grate the cheese and keep aside.slice the edges of the bread if you prefer. spread butter evenly on all the slices. make sure the butter covers the entire of bread. a generous coating of butter does not allow the bread to become soggy, when you apply the chutney.spread the mint-coriander chutney on all the bread slices.place the onion, tomato, potato and capsicum slices. sprinkle a pinch of chaat masala or sandwich masala evenly on them. also sprinkle a pinch of black salt evenly.now top with grated cheese.cover the sandwiches with the remaining bread slices and place in a preheated toaster or grill.toast for 2 to 3 minutes till the bread gets toasted well and golden. toast the remaining sandwiches in the same way.spread some butter on top of the hot sandwiches and serve cheese toast sandwich hot with the remaining chutney and tomato sauce.
